cont.entity_a: The pan had a poor level of finish with scratches and a sharp rim that could trap food.
cont.entity_b: The copper cladding is extremely light and wears off after one use. Copper finish is not durable and tarnishes quickly. The copper exterior is only a finish and deteriorates after use.

cont.entity_a: Warping issues occurred twice with minimal use.
The manufacturer refused to inspect the pan and required going through the dealer for replacement.
The protective beeswax coating was difficult to remove.
Seasoning attempts did not prevent food from sticking.
cont.entity_b: Requires a lot of oil to prevent sticking. Difficult to clean due to food sticking easily.

cont.entity_a: Pan warped when used on an induction stove. Heats quickly and evenly, but warps when used on electric stove tops.
The bottom is not flat, causing uneven heating on a smooth glass surface.
cont.entity_b: The pans heat evenly and maintain temperature well.

cont.entity_a: The pan arrived with scratches but worked well once seasoned.
cont.entity_b: The pots arrived with spots and marks but cleaned up with bar keepers friend.

cont.entity_a: The pan is well-made with a welded handle and no rivets.
The pan is heavy but offers good heat distribution. The pan is lighter than cast iron but heavier than non-stick aluminum pans.
cont.entity_b: The set is heavier than previous non-stick Calphalon.

cont.entity_a: The seasoning process was challenging but resulted in a non-stick surface.

cont.entity_b: Pans require copper cleaner to maintain appearance. The set is attractive but requires high maintenance.
The cookware is not induction compatible despite claims.
Copper changes color with heat but can be cleaned to a shiny finish.
The design and heat distribution are top class.
